lines.text: Sometimes I sing and dance around the house in my underwear. Doesn't make me Madonna. Never will.

[to Katherine]
Look, you, maybe you've got everyone around here fooled with this saint act you have going, but do not ever speak to me again like we don't know what really happened, you got me?
Tess, this is business. Let's just bury the hatchet, okay?
You know where you can bury your hatchet? Now get your bony ass outta my sight!
[in the bar]
I have a head for business and a bod for sin. Is there anything wrong with that?
Uh, no. No.
[Looking through Katherine Parker's wardrobe]
Six thousand dollars? It's not even leather!
Can I get ya anything? Coffee? Tea? Me?
What if he doesn't?... pop the question?
I really don't think that's a variable. We're in the same city now, I've indicated that I'm receptive to an offer, I've cleared the month of June... and I am, after all, me.
Dress shabbily, they notice the dress. Dress impeccably, they notice the woman - Coco Chanel!
You're the first woman I've seen at one of these things that dresses like a woman, not like a woman thinks a man would dress if he was a woman.
Thank you I guess.
[about Jack's chin scar]
How did you get the scar?
Some guy pulled a knife in Detroit.
Really?
No. No. I was nineteen and I thought it'd be cool to have a pierced ear. My girlfriend stuck the needle through and I heard this pop and fainted and hit my chin on the toilet.
I am not steak. You can't just order me.
Tess, will you marry me?
Maybe.
Ya call that an answer?
You want another answer, ask another girl.
[the morning after Tess passed out from drinking]
What did happen, exactly?
The earth moved. The angels wept. The Polaroids are, are, uh...
[gropes about in his coat pockets]
are in my other coat.
[Grins]
Nothing happened. Nothing happened!
Now get your - what was that you called it?
Bony ass.
Yes - your bony ass out of my sight!
Ugh! What a slob.
You were so smooth with him.
Never burn bridges. Today's junior *prick*, tomorrow's senior partner.
Whaddya need speech class for, ya talk fine!
You can bend the rules plenty once you get to the top, but not while you're trying to get there. And if you're someone like me, you can't get there without bending the rules.
You've got a real fire in your belly, or was this just a one-time stunt that you pulled?
I'm not quite sure what you mean, sir. I've got something in my belly, but I think it's nervous knots.
You know, maybe I just don't like you.
Me? Naaah!
[Upon reading Tess' day planner]
Why that little... slut! Bitch! Secretary!

[pretending to be her boss]
I know what I'm doing.
Yeah, screwing up your life.
No, I'm trying to make it better! I'm not gonna spend the rest of my life working my ass off and getting nowhere just because I followed rules that I had nothing to do with setting up, OK?
Tess, Tess, Tess, Tess. You don't get ahead in this world by calling your boss a pimp.
Well, he is.
Never burn bridges. Today's junior prick, tomorrow's senior partner!

[trailer]
How 'bout you?
I'm flat broke, I'm crazy about a man that I will probably never see again...
Well, *besides* that!
[Tess laughs sadly]
Been lookin at your file here. This the third time in six months I had to place you.
Wasn't my fault.
Where've I heard THAT before?

Ruth, lookit - I'm thirty years old. Took me five years of night school, but I got my degree and I got it with honors; I *know* I could do a job. I mean, you ask any of my bosses - even, even Lutz! - if Tess McGill hasn't called a few.
YOU ask 'em. I don't think they're gonna sing your praises, Tess.
Bob, you're not seriously looking for a new assistant, are you?
Well, not exactly at this moment, but I'm always on the lookout for new blood.
I'm hungry, Bob, but I am not that hungry!
Why does it do that?
Cleaning...
Are you kiddin' me?
Uhm, Ms. McGill?
Yes.

[pointing to private office]
That's your desk... in there...
I don't think so.
Oh, yes.
Sorry, I thought the secretary would sit out here...
That's right, I'm the secretary. If you don't mind, I'd prefer assistant.

[from her new, private office]
Hey, Cyn. Guess where I am.

[Mick has bought Tess some lingerie for her birthday]
Y'know, Mick, just once I could go for like a sweater or some earrings... something that I could actually wear outside of this apartment?

[after taking several shots of tequila, on top of Diazepam/Valium recommended by Cynthia]
Oh boy, oh boy, oh boy, oh boy, oh boy... mmm...
You ok?
Mmm... fine... I took an "antihistamine" before and it makes for a nice little buzz.
Shoot me, shoot me.
Will you cut that out, they didn't throw you out did they?
They don't exactly have bouncers at these things, they're a little more subtle than that.

[on the phone]
Cyn! Guess where I am...
[giggles]

[stands up, screams to secretaries]
She got out! Oh my god! I can't believe it, she's out - she made it out! She got out! She has her own office!
Oren Trask? The man who said, "What if we sliced the bread before we sold it?"
Oh god - and last night!
Yeah, I shouldda checked the milligrams. Live and learn.
